clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Cohort Study for Varicose Veins Incidence and Natural Course
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Cohort Study for Varicose Veins Incidence and Natural Course

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective study of individuals without varicose veins and who have primary varicose veins to assess the morbidity, risk factors and natural course of chronic lower limb vein disease.

detailed_description.textblock: Multicenter prospective cohort observational study based on a termless epidemiological registry. Periodic inspection and collection of data from the subjects is carried out annually, in the last quarter of the current year. Patient data is recorded in a digital database and is constantly updated

primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with the first identified varicose veins (class C2 according to CEAP classification)

secondary_outcome.description: The presence of varicose veins in new areas of the lower extremites (each limb is divided into 8 areas: thigh - anterior, posterior, medial, lateral area; lower leg - anterior, posterior, medial, lateral area)
Number of participants with the first identified sign of chronic venous insufficiency (venous edema, venous eczema, hyperpigmentation of the skin, lipodermatosclerosis, venous ulcer)
Number of participants with first episode of superficial vein thrombosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of reticular and telangiectatic leg veins
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with the first identified eticular and telangiectatic leg veins ((class C1 according to CEAP classification)

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression of reticular and telangiectatic leg veins
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of reticular and telangiectatic leg veins in new areas of the lower extremites (each limb is divided into 8 areas: thigh - anterior, posterior, medial, lateral area; lower leg - anterior, posterior, medial, lateral area)

arm_group.description: Individuals who do not have varicose veins of lower legs: C0, C1 classes according to Clinical, Etiologic, Anatomic and Pathophysiologic classification (CEAP)
Individuals who have varicose veins of lower legs: C2 Ep class according to Clinical, Etiologic, Anatomic and Pathophysiologic classification (CEAP)

study_pop.textblock:
The main cohort is formed from those who do not have varicose veins, who are affected by different factors that we register (various physical activities, the presence or absence of pregnancy, etc.).
An additional cohort is formed from those who have varicose veins at the time of inclusion.
The goal is to track the natural evolution (progression) of the disease, to evaluate the incidence and risk factors of complications.
An extremely important criterion for the formation of the study population is the possibility to control the lower legs veins of observed individuals by a qualified vascular specialist. To date, a qualitative assessment of veins according to the CEAP classification is a weak point in longitudinal epidemiological studies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A family members of the researcher (spouse, childrens, brothers and sisters, parents) or the researcher himself
- The possibility of annual clinical and ultrasound assessment of the venous system of the observed individuals
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any invasive treatment of the chronic venous disorder in anamnesis
- Venous thrombosis in the anamnesis or at the time of inclusion

link.description: The accumulation of data will be carried out on the basis of an termless Russian epidemiological registry, ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT04487314
